detailsOfAchievement: Aradhana Dance Academy,one of the premier cultural institutions of Orissa, runs under the guidance of Chitrasen Swain, a renowned educator, performer and choreographer of Odissi dance and gotipua dance. Established in the year 2009, it has made remarkable contributions in projecting and popularizing Odissi dance and music, as well as imparting intensive training to artistes both in India and abroad. It maintains a professional association with several cultural institutions in India, USA,UK,France,Japan,Russia,Airlend. Upholding a rich cultural heritage, the Academy has moved ahead with its noble and dynamic mission to embrace many artistes into its cultural fold. Through its multifaceted activities it aims at international cultural amity and harmony. It is a unique institution where studios are never silent. Training classes are conducted by eminent and experienced Odissi gurus in a scientific manner round the clock. Academyâ€™s First Goal is to provide high class training to make future Gurus in Odissi Dance.

detailsOfAchievement: Aranyak is proud to associated with Ministry of Human Resources Development, Govt. of India to run Jan Shikshan Sansthan(JSS) at Sambalpur. The mail objective of the program is to strengthen the adult literacy program as well as provide vocational training to the unemployed youths to make them self-employed. Aranyak has adopted one village under Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana where we have started a vocational training program from 30th November,2015. The organization has been continuing its program on ethical treatment of animals. Under the program Aranyak is running a Gosalla (Cow Shelter) for the abandoned cows and bullocks where there abandoned animals are provided shelter, fodder and healthcare. Aranyak is running health program awareness camp e.g. Reproductive and child health, HIV/AIDS control program, Malaria control program. Program on women: Aranyak is organizing training program for self-help group and micro-finance program for women in order to enable women to run their groups independently. Program on women atrocities and awareness on women labor has been conducted throughout years. Program on Education: Implementation of inclusive education for disable at secondary stage (IEDSS), enrolment drive and teachers training. Program on Livelihood: Natural resources management, training on agriculture, promotion of medicinal plant cultivation, water and sanitation program, environment awareness campaign.

detailsOfAchievement: The Tribal Lively-hood is based upon their LAND, FOREST and CULTURE. Land provides food for three to four months a year where as the Forest provides food for eight to nine months and some times they go for wage earning and Culture is the life of the Tribal people. In this juncture, we have involved them in different lifesaving activities like Food Security and Health Security in order to save their lives. In order to face the anti-social elements of the society we have organizing Peoples forum.

ACHIEVEMENTS AROHEE, since its inception in 1984, is striving hard for the development of handicraft artisans of Orissa. Marketing the artistic products of our artisans has became a problem since long. To address this problem, AROHEE has taken steps to provide them a good platform throughout the state every year. The organization took keen interest in formation, training and capacity building of the group in management, credit and thrift linking with financial institutions, accountancy and documentation. Nutrition for women and children, Reproductive and Child Health, Water and Sanitation programme, Livestock development etc. The organization has evolved in scale and structure over the years. Many of the programmes have been scaled up and many are in the pipeline. Structurally the activities of the organization have diversified our preference significantly. detailsOfAchievement: Our scope of work extended to climate change and environment (renewable energy) interventions in remote corners of India, livelihoods, organisation development, education, health, child development and protection project, women empowerment and gender, disaster management, rescue relief and resettlement during floods, WASH, strategic communication, corporate social responsibility etc.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The objective was to make the publick aware of issues relating to Biodiversity and the need for conservation as the village is just 3 kms from the forest and the people depend on the forest for fuel wood and others.

Arupa Mission have been involved in need based computer aided knowledge transfer since 2004 onwards. Our stakeholders include women, men and children. We will be slowly including transgender in our digital empowerment programmes.

A workshop was organised in which 100 women and 50 children from villages participated. The resource persons were two headmasters from local schools and a social activist. During the workshop focus was also on recycling bio degradable waste for making compost and plantation. The women participated in developing a community plantation with initially planting 50 fruit bearing trees and they took a decision that they would maintain the plantation on a rotational basis.

Project Shakti is a CSR initiative designed and implemented by Arupa Mission Research Foundation with support from McCain Foods India Pvt. Ltd. The main objectives are- Empowering girls and women to enhance their options of livelihoods, bring positive changes in their lives for a better tomorrow and prevention of any form of violence against girls and women.

title: ARYABHATTA FOUNDATION
detailsOfAchievement: Aryabhatta Foundation was created on 20th Jan 2009 with the objectives of (a) spreading scientific education among general public and spreading awareness against superstition (b) spreading awareness on climate change (c) Empowering socially and economically weaker children to pursue higher studies and spread education among the weaker section of the society. To fulfill its objectives it plants trees every year and runs an awareness vehicle called SABUJA RATHA (Green chariot) every year to spread awareness for plantation and distributes saplings among general public in the district of Ganjam, Odisha also uses folk songs and dances for the purpose. It organizes competitions among the students for the purpose stated above, grants scholarships to weaker section students to pursue higher studies. Organizes programmes against superstition. During Phailine in the district of Ganjam the Aryabhatta Foundation had engaged itself in the relief work and erected hundreds of trees grounded by the devastating cyclone. It has done all these work from the contribution of the chairman and its volunteers. It has neither received nor applied for any Government or any other fund.

ASHA has been managing a Short Stay Home since 2007 at Lipinda of Jujumura block in Sambalpur district since 2007. detailsOfAchievement: Education: At 3066Primary and Upper Primary Schools of Komana& Nuapada Block of Nuapada &220 Schools of Bargarh & Sohela Block of Bargarh District facilitating Aflatoun Child Social and Financial Programme.The Aflatoon progromme envisage poverty reduction by equipping children with the knowledge, Skills and Confidence to become self reliant citizen whose sense of social and financial responsibility propel them to create more equitable society in future with following objectives: To make the children aware of child Rights & to develop in children, a sense of responsibility To make children understand what their needs are & learn to prioritize them and look for ways to be able to fulfil necessities in their life. To instil in children, a sense of pride at their ability to intervene in their own world. To inculcate the habit of savings among children. To develop in children, the ability to handle money. To encourage children to think their own, identify right from wrong and to look at things from a scientific perspective. To give children the opportunities to think and plan for their future and take related decision. To provide exposure to banking operation and financial education. The banking activity and the issue based work; linking day-to-day realities of life of the children will motivate children to come to school. COMMUNITY HEALTH: Strengthening existing child health services Essential newborn care (Breast feeding, warmth, Hygiene, cord care and recognition of danger signs) Immunization Skilled care at and after birth Control of diarrhoeal diseases and ARI Breastfeeding and complementary feeding Micronutrient supplementation (Vitamin A, Iron) Besides above stated micro monitoring and counselling we also work for Facilitating Village Health Plan Organizing School Health Programe Organizing & Facilitating Community Monitoring on Routine Immunization Counselling for at least 3 Antenatal Check up and Institutional delivery Monitoring Pulse Polio Programme at Nuapada and Bolangir District with the support of NPSP- WHO AGRICULTURE: ASHA supports village communities in undertaking sustainable management of natural resources through a variety of interventions and bringing change in the cultivation Practices also by promoting community forestry and horticulture, land and water conservation and development. Our specific interventions are as follows: Promoting Land based crop cultivation -34 acre Facilitating Soil testing & Soil Health Promotional Measures-100 farmers Facilitating Mix Cropping-15 farmers Training on Dry land farming, Mix cropping,- 20 farmers Training on Land, water & Soil Management-40 farmers Promoting Organic farming & Vegetable cultivation- 23 farmers Community Organization: The premise is that the engagement with the development process initiated by ASHA is a springboard to enable the community to tackle all other development issues that it faces in a holistic manner by using Village Planning as a tool. Community Forestry: ASHA motivates communities to collectively manage their forests and horticulture plantations. Communities have been motivated to regenerate common and private wastelands by growing trees for fuel, fruit, fodder and timber and also develop horticulture patches. These community forests and horticultural plots help to protect the local environment. The process of management and sharing benefits enhances cohesiveness of the communities and also yields substantial incomes.

detailsOfAchievement: ARUNA is known as a pioneering health NGO in the state of Orissa concentrating the issue of migration and HIV/AIDS since 1995. We work in Ganjam district with the out-migrant population, their families and adolescents, youths on HIV/AIDS and Sexual Reproductive Health. Over the years we have touched the entire gamut of HIV/AIDS and worked / participated in different layers of HIV prevention, control, planning, study, research, advocacy and networking. Now in our 10 years strategy we have included another global challenge that is Climate Change. It is a correlated issue to migration, HIV. Hence we have decided to work locally on this issue also.

detailsOfAchievement: Association for Voluntary Action (AVA) was conceptualized in the year First January 1980 as a non profit making voluntary Organisation and formally registered under Societies Registration Act XXI of 1860 in the year 1982 with the primary objective for socio-economic upliftment of rural poor and vulnerable section of the society. Latter on it was registered under Foreign Contribution Regulation Act 1976. Since then, it has been working tirelessly for the welfare of Older Persons, Person with Disabilities, Women and Children, and other deprived, marginalized and underprivileged sections of the society. During this long trek our Association carves out a name for itself as a leading Voluntary Organisation in the State. Presently our Association is providing both Institutional and Non Institutional services to the above said sections of the society. The brief summary of activities of the association is as follows. PROGRAMME FOR THE WELFARE OF WOMEN and GIRLS Short Stay Home Women and Girls in distress funded by Central Social Welfare Board, New Delhi At-Dampur, PO- Berboi, Dist-Puri. Swadhar Center and Help Line for women in difficult circumstances , Min.of WCD Govt. of India, At-Sundargarh Town, Dist- Sundargarh Programme on prevention of Violence against Women, PROGAMME FOR WELFARE OF THE CHILDREN CrÃ¨che Centre for children of working and ailing mothers (10nos) funded by Central Social Welfare Board,New Delhi in Lephripada Block of Sundargarh District. WELFARE OF THE OLDER PERSONS Old Age Home (2nos) for destitute older person. Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India 1. At-Dampur, Po-Berboi, Dist-Puri. 2 .At- Telendihi Po-Telendihi,Dist- Sundargarh. Multi Service Centre For the Aged , Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India ,in Delang Block of Puri District. Mobile Medicare Unit for Aged, Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India in Delang Block of Puri District. WELFARE OF THE PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES: Residential Special School For Handicapped Children, Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India At-Dampur, PO- Berboi, Dist-Puri. Home for the Leprosy Cured Person and Vocational Training Centre, Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India At-Dampur, PO- Berboi, Dist-Puri. Community Based Rehabilitation Programme For Handicapped, Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India in Delang Block of Puri District. Prolonged Stay Facility for C.P, M.R & M.D At-Dampur, PO- Berboi, Dist-Puri. PROGRAMME FOR WELFARE OF SC AND ST Residential Secondary School for ST Girls , funded by Min. of Tribal Affairs At-Telendih, Po-Telendihi,Dist- Sundargarh PROGRAMME ON PROHIBITION AND DRUG ABUSE PREVENTION 15 bedded Integrated Rehabilitation and Counselling Centre for Addicts (2nos), Funded by Min.of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt of India PROGRAMME ON HIV AIDS Targeted Intervention project on HIV AIDS for, I D Us in Puri Town with assistance from Orissa State AIDS Control Society. PROGRAMME FOR WELFARE OF CHILD LABOUR Child labour School (2nos). for children rescued from different hazardous sectors in Puri Town. Relief and Rehabilitation Relief and Rehabilitation work at the time of natural calamities. AWARENESS GENERATION PROGRAMMES ON Environment Protection, HIV AIDS, Consumer Protection and awareness, Right to Information etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Womens community management group is a state level womens voluntary organization. It is registered under the Societies Registration Act XXX-1860 with IGR Cuttack. Presently the organization is woring for the poor needy women, schedule cast / schedule tribe, child and physically and mentally retared people. The Organization is situated in Sankarpur mouza of Bolagarh Block inside the Khurda District of Orissa which is 72 Kms from the State Capital Bhubaneswar. It has own Building Office artcles. Now it has 250 numbers of women of its member. Now the organization is taking the responsbility of 133 nos. Leporsy Cured Persons for their Vocational training and fooding and the health checkup in a permanent basis. In every year the organization is giving Computer training to 60 nos. women, 300 nos. of women are taking training of Bamboo product and bamboo house-hold articles and the regular items and 500 Nos. of women are taking training on food processing. In addition every year we are also giving short term training on the tailoring, embroidery and printing to 200 nos. of women. We also support for the placement of the trainees and provide the production centre for them.

The Ayas attend to the daily needs which include personal hygiene, food and medication. Doctor of the Public Healthcare Centre attends to the medical needs of the children. The Ayas / Social Workers attending to them have to look after them in the same way as one would take care of an infant, i.e, complete personal hygiene, preventive action for communicable dis

In the Maa Gruha managed by WOSCA, our social workers also take care of housekeeping of the Maa Gruha and address the counselling as well as recreational needs of patients and attendants. The service of a gynaecologist is provided on daily basis. The patients are also counselledregularly. Total 241 pregnant mothers were admitted in this year. Total 210 live birth was realized. To the inmates of the waiting Home, health check up and nutrition are provided in free of cost.

detailsOfAchievement: The tribal and remote belt of Odisha comprising districts in south and western Orissa are inhabited by people who are conventionally backward and vulnerable due to inconsistent livelihoods. Poverty is pervasive mostly due to lack of proper access to and use of natural resources and low level of education and awareness. These areas are part of the contiguous poorest region of the country consisting of parts of Orissa and Chhattisgarh (CG): all the eight KBK districts, Southern Orissa, and three districts of Bastar region of CG. This region is one of the poorest regions of South Asia (Indian Subcontinent) with over two-thirds of people living below the poverty line. Moreover it has a high proportion (over two-thirds) of Tribal and Dalit communities. The area suffers from abject poverty and lack of local livelihood opportunities resulting in a high rate of distress migration. Compounding the difficulties in some pockets is the crippling effects of the Naxalite activities. Over two-thirds of the population consists of tribes and dalits (10-15%). The tribes are of various ethnic groups and are socio-economically more deprived than others. Within their ranks, there exists wide socio-economic divergence. Making them even more vulnerable are low literacy and serious health problems, caused by various factors such as early marriage, improper sanitation and hygiene, and inadequacy of nutritious food. Their aspirations and self-image are low. Outside influences are marginal and societal changes are slow. Even within one district, some pockets and blocks are more disadvantaged than others: these areas have poorer connectivity and no agricultural development, land distribution is skewed, there is low degree of undulation and vegetation, forest cover has diminished, and there is lack of infrastructure. The degree of entrepreneurship within different tribal communities is also varied. Following are some of the more common features of the area: â€¢ Undulating terrain with intermittent hills. â€¢ Slash and burn (Podu) cultivation is practiced by the tribal communities in varying degrees. â€¢ Ecologically, the area is at its early stage of deterioration. â€¢ Cultivable lands are mainly terraced, located in valleys, varies from 10% to 30% of the geographical area and highly topography-specific. â€¢ With less than 15% irrigation coverage, the area is mainly rain fed with traditional practices of mixed cropping to combat risks. â€¢ Around 70% of the farmers are small and marginal farmers and they own 50% of total agricultural land. Landlessness ranges from 15 to 30% in different blocks. â€¢ Cropping is mainly for household consumption and sustenance. â€¢ Commercial crops like tobacco and chilly is found in few pockets only. â€¢ Low agricultural productivity Food sufficiency varies from three to nine months a year, forcing families to migrate or find other livelihoods options such as selling wood in the local markets. Poverty, unemployment and lack of access to services have contributed to the spread of Naxalite activities in some of these pockets. To alleviate poverty and counter Naxalite there have been many specific programme launched by both state and central government. The programmes like OTELP (Orissa Tribal Empowerment and Livelihood Programme), NREGA (National Rural Employment Guarantee Act) and WADI programme are targeted towards livelihood enhancement, employment generation and infrastructure creation; and if implemented in right spirit can make difference to the lives of many So the thrust would be to have synergetic collaborations and work on a multi-prong approach in order to: â€¢ Build strong community based organizations as the channels of development that can continuously access resources and services from different agencies for betterment of its members. â€¢ Judiciously invest in land and water resources to sustainably increase the crop production to provide round the year food sufficiency to the families and generate marketable surplus. â€¢ Promote micro enterprises for mostly the landless and also to supplement farm income. â€¢ Device strategies through which the development prototypes fit into a revenue model and are replicable over large area. In a scenario where independent efforts by civil society organizations, government or the industry have had limited success in alleviating poverty, there is need and opportunity to join hands to demonstrate and replicate models of development that can transform the lives of large number of poor. Project: Expanding Development Interventions of GDS GDS with its presence in poverty stricken western Orissa, has been able to make significant impact in improving the quality of life of the rural poor. The organization has promoted community based institutions like women Self Help Groups, their federations and cooperatives and linked them to mainstream institutions for different livelihood enhancement programmes. More than 100 SHGs and 10district level cooperatives have been formed. Different livelihood interventions are designed and delivered catering to the needs of both the landless and the landed. Agro-horticulture intervention under ITDAâ€™s wadi model and improved agriculture (SRI paddy, improved millet, maize and vegetable cultivation) with suitable irrigation infrastructures like ring wells; gravity and lift irrigation are being implemented with more than 2500 families in the district. For the landless commercial broiler poultry farming and scientific goat rearing are being promoted with 400 families in the districts. The poultry intervention has garnered support from ITDA for its expansion and has also been integrated with maize farming in more than 600 acres per season in the local area for poultry feed, hatchery of 1.2 lakh chicks per month capacity for supplying chicks to its members and stock point at urban centre for retailing. The Project seeks part-support for expanding, intensifying and piloting the various livelihood enhancement programs in the endemically poor districts of Orissa. The Project seeks to co-finance development support costs of GDS teams, support development of community based organizations, fostering collaboration with other NGOs and livelihood prototype development in the new and existing project locations.

detailsOfAchievement: Gopinath Club has been implementing various programmes on health, education, culture and rural community development with the most marginalized section in their participation and involvement. It has achieved so many successive steps on health promotion in rural communities implementing immunization programmes. It has developed so many balwadis and trained ANMs & AWWs in support of child education and health at grass root level. It has also been addressing district level awareness programmes for the development of culture and traditions of Orissa. GC as a grass root level organization implemented so many programmes with the community for the betterment in the areas of health, education and livelihood. Various cultural groups were supported and encouraged to present their best at the community to encourage people for an inclination towards ancient culture of orissa. It rather provided scope to other groups of energetic youths for creating various cultural groups on folk songs, dances and dramas. The awareness for the care towards the geriatric persons, distressed women and orphans were also undertaken with the CBOs, SHGs, ANMs, AWWs, youth clubs and various district level and state level stakeholders. With the activities of health and educational development GC had undertaken various awareness programmes with the teachers, parents and the district level authorities of education. GC organized so many health camps at different block level health quarters for the treatment of the common ailments which rather infected into the chronicsâ€‚ GC has undertaken so many programmes on disability. The children with disability, person with disability and women with disability were included into the target groups and provided rehabilitation at the community. So, various training programmes were undertaken for the parents to prepare them for supporting the activity daily living skill of the CWDs/ PWDs/WWDs to provide them a right to live with dignity. GC has host the leadership among other agencies has been working at social field. The remarkable result of the interventions encouraged the people to support GC for leading the community in support of their health, education and livelihood.

detailsOfAchievement: HEALTH Community Mobilization Slum sensitization, Mahila Arogya Samiti(MAS) formation and orientation and strengthening, Formation and orientation of Ward Kalyan Samiti, Formation and orientation of Rogi Kalyan Samiti, Training to Front Line Workers (Urban ASHAs and AWWs) Mobile Health Unit (MHU) The mobile health unit has covered 205 slums of Bhubaneswar city and the health screening and treatment has done in a well- planning manner to cover all the slums equally. In the year 2015-16 total 12679 patients were treated AWARENESS CAMP Yoga camp: On 22nd June 2015 on the eve of World Yoga Day GJS has organized a yoga camp with collaboration with Artatrana Bidya Niketan. Around 130 students have participated on the eve and did yoga asana and the instructor taught them the usefulness of various yoga asana. RTI and STI awareness: The reproductive tract Infection and sexual transmitted disease are very common during the adolescent period. So to educate various prevention methods and hygiene practices camps were organized at various slums of Bhubaneswar. AIDS Awareness Program:For the year 2015-2016 Gopinath Juba sangha (GJS) organized World AIDS Day on 1st December 2015 in JANJYOTI SEVA SANGHA, Kedarpalli, Bapuji Nagar, Bhubaneswar. DENGUE, MALARIA & FILARIA AWARENES: During this year we have organized Malaria & Filaria eradication program at Brahmeswar patna Basti on dated 19/03/2016 and 125 no slum peoples were participated. 20 no of Pala Programs have arranged and played in urban slum as well as on rural areas of Balipatana, Khordha and Jatani & Pipil Blocks. Water, Sanitation & Hygiene Construction of IHHL under Swachha Bharat Mission:- In this year under Swaccha Bharat Mission GJS appointed two coordinators each in Balipatna, Balianta, Jatani, Bhubaneswar block of Khordha district. Under this project 800 Individual House Hold Latrine were constructed by GJS with the financial aid by District Water Sanitation Mission, Khordha under Swachha Bharat Mission (Gramin) project. Awareness to create Open Defecation Free Village To ensure sanitation facilities in rural areas with broader goal to eradicate the practice of open defecation. Women Empowerment:- We have formed 80 no of SHG groups in Balipatana and Balianta Block. Capacity building training was given to 400 no of SHG members regarding making of Badi, Papad, Spices, Bamboo works, Agarbati making, appliquÃ© and mushroom cultivation. Agriculture & Animal Husbandary Awareness on Dairy Farming 2 no of interface have made with local farmers. 64 no of women have attended by our resource person Dr. Sudarshan Bhuyan (Rtd. Professor). Mushroom Cultivation Due to lack of training facility regarding production of mushroom the farmers are facing lot of problems. In this context we have arranged a training camp regarding mushroom cultivation. 42 no of women have trained on that training camp. EDUCATION:- Children Education Program We have engaged part time teachers of different courses about 200 poor school going children of poor family have benefited by this program. Our organization managing 2 no of UPHCs on Bhubnaeswar & Berhampur. 2 no of MHUs have been moving in different slums of BBSR.

detailsOfAchievement: GJS of society from its days of creation is facing various problems in its day to day life. The various problems are drought, flood, famine, earth quake, pollution problem etc and also there are many other problems which have been created by men himself. Out of these human made problems are dowry, rape, divorce etc. All these hindrances are creating drawbacks on the way of success. Development is a word which is broad based and it is not easy to describe it. But can be proved on the theory practical things and doings. It is the world of heard and hand. So to perform the duty of heard and hand some organizations have dried heard and are marching on the way which is leading to successful development of human civilitation and their standard of living. Only for the broad based word to prove it the non-Governmental organizations and dedicating their valuable time and life like the activist â€œBaba Gopalâ€ and our organization one among the all other organization. GJS is a non-govt. non-profit making and secular voluntary organization. A view to take collective step for aliviating poverty and providing primary education and Health Care to the poorest families in rural area with other social, economical, political and legal advantages, a group of young men & women come forward with concept of equal vision and mission to serve the poor deprived people of underprivileged communities in an organized body which later came to fore in the name of Gopinath Jubak Sangha having its head quarters at Patanpur, Delang, Puri in Delang Block, Orissa. Since its legal entity in 1978 the organization has been accomplishing its accountabilities on various welfare and developmental spheres to the best satisfaction of the beneficiaries as well as Donor agencies. During reporting period the organization has triumphed as community in its true sense is defined a group of people sharing common identity with similar characteristics and belief the organization has been starving for surveillance of equity through strategic management on common course amidst a number of constraints and pitfalls formulated by vested interest circles on crÃ¨che of children care water & sanitation and Disaster Risk Management and school sanitation program, National Environment Awareness campaign, health awareness program, family welfare program, agriculture Devt. Program, aid control program, health check-up work shop, advance water & sanitation program, organizing DRM Program, raising children & women working Hostel, library books, adult education, waving & stone carpentry, food protection camp & free cost kitchen, crÃ¨che camp program, weste land Devt. & waste water disposal, conservation of bio-diversity Environmental management ecological preservation, cultural program, sports & art competition, flood protection embankment & renovation of tank, consumer protection program, SHG formation program etc. acquiring popular good will in its activities with selfness and devoted spirit.
